ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Recall context for survey
Notes: e.g., ''Thinking of your entire lifetime'' or ''Since April 1, 2020''

ElementDescription: How would you rate your general health?
Notes: 1 = Excellent; 2 = Very good; 3 = Good; 4 = Fair; 5 = Poor; 97 = Do not know; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: How would you rate your quality of life? Is it...
Notes: 1 = Excellent; 2 = Very good; 3 = Good; 4 = Fair; 5 = Poor; 97 = Do not know; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: How would you describe your current level of exercise or physical activity?
Notes: 1 = Vigorous or heavy such as running, swimming, hiking, or biking uphill; 2 = Moderate such as walking briskly, biking in flat areas or weight lifting; 3 = Light such as walking or stretching, or light housework; 4 = No exercise; 96 = Disabled; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Is there a place you usually go when you are sick or need advice about your health?
What kind of place do you go to most often when you are sick or need advice about your health?
Notes: 1 = Clinic or health center; 2 = Doctor''s office or HMO; 3 = Hospital emergency room; 4 = Hospital outpatient department; 5 = Some other place; 6 = No one place go to most often; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: About how long has it been since you last visited a doctor or clinic for a routine checkup? A routine checkup is a general physical exam, not an exam for a specific injury, illness, or condition.
Notes: 1 = Within past 12 months; 2 = Within past 2 years; 3 = Within past 5 years; 4 = 5 or more years ago; 5 = Never; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: How old were you on your most recent birthday? [If you are over 90 years of age, please enter 90.]
Notes: Age in years; 90= 90 years or older; 99= No answer

ElementDescription: Have you ever been told by a doctor or other health professional that you had hypertension, also called high blood pressure?
Doctor or other health professional said you have hypertension/high blood pressure - At what age were you first told that?
Have you ever been told by a doctor or other health professional that you had any heart or coronary problem?
Doctor or other health professional said you have heart or coronary problem - At what age were you first told that?
Have you ever been told by a doctor or other health professional that you had diabetes?
Doctor or other health professional said you have diabetes - At what age were you first told that?
Have you ever been told by a doctor or other health professional that you had injuries from a serious accident?
Doctor or other health professional said you had injuries from a serious accident - At what age were you first told that?
Have you ever been told by a doctor or other health professional that you had a stroke?
Doctor or other health professional said you had a stroke - At what age were you first told that?
Have you ever been told by a doctor or other health professional that you had cancer?
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - At what age were you first told that?
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Breast)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Lung)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Prostate)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Colon)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Skin cancer or melanoma)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Bladder or kidney)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Lymphoma or leukemia)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Endometrial, uterine, or ovarian)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Pancreatic)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Thyroid)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Liver)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Head and neck (oral cancer)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Cervical)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (Other)
Doctor or other health professional said you had cancer - What type(s) of cancer did you have at that time? Select all that apply. (No answer)
Which type of cancer were you diagnosed with first?
Notes: 1 = Breast; 2 = Lung; 3 = Prostate; 4 = Colon; 5 = Skin cancer or melanoma; 6 = Bladder or kidney; 7 = Lymphoma or leukemia; 8 = Endometrial, uterine or ovarian; 9 = Pancreatic; 10 = Thyroid; 11 = Liver; 12 = Head and neck (oral cancer); 13 = Cervical; 14 = Other; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Do you suffer from any type of chronic pain that occurs constantly or flares up frequently?
[nas_recall] - Have you seen or talked to a doctor about your pain?
Are you deaf or blind or do you have serious difficulty hearing or seeing (even when wearing glasses)?
Do you have serious difficulty walking or climbing stairs?
Did your drinking change after you learned you had hypertension?
How did your drinking change after you learned you had hypertension? (I increased how often I drink (ex. drink more days per week or per month))
How did your drinking change after you learned you had hypertension? (I increased how much I drink (ex. drink more drinks on an occasion))
How did your drinking change after you learned you had hypertension? (I reduced how often I drink (ex. drink fewer days per week or per month))
How did your drinking change after you learned you had hypertension? (I reduced how much I drink (ex. drink fewer drinks on an occasion))
How did your drinking change after you learned you had hypertension? (I quit drinking)
How did your drinking change after you learned you had hypertension? (No answer)
How long did you quit drinking after you learned you had hypertension?
Notes: 1 = Less than a month; 2 = One to six months; 3 = Seven months to one year; 4 = Longer than a year; 5 = I still do not drink; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Has a doctor or other health professional ever talked with you about your alcohol use?
Doctor or other health professional talked with you about your alcohol use - When was the last time this happened?
Notes: 1 = Within past 12 months; 2 = Within past 2 years; 3 = Within past 5 years; 4 = 5 or more years ago; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: When your doctor or other health professional asked about your alcohol use, what did they say? (They asked how much you drink.)
When your doctor or other health professional asked about your alcohol use, what did they say? (They asked how often you drink.)
When your doctor or other health professional asked about your alcohol use, what did they say? (They asked if you have any problems because of your drinking.)
When your doctor or other health professional asked about your alcohol use, what did they say? (They advised you to cut down on your drinking.)
When your doctor or other health professional asked about your alcohol use, what did they say? (They gave you information about treatment for alcohol problems.)
When your doctor or other health professional asked about your alcohol use, what did they say? (They said something else.)
When your doctor or other health professional asked about your alcohol use, what did they say? (No answer)
Do you regularly take any medications that indicate you should limit your alcohol use?
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No; 97 = Do not know/not sure; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Have you ever had flushing or redness of your face, nausea, drowsiness, sluggishness, or rapid heartbeat or pulse rate after drinking just one beer or other alcohol drink?
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No; 97 = Do not know/not sure; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Flushing or redness of your face, nausea, drowsiness, sluggishness, or rapid heartbeat or pulse rate after drinking just one beer or alcohol drink - Do you still have these symptoms when you drink alcohol?
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No; 97 = Do not know/not sure; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Flushing or redness of your face, nausea, drowsiness, sluggishness, or rapid heartbeat or pulse rate after drinking just one beer or alcohol drink - The last time this happened, how severe was this?
Notes: 0= Not at all severe; 10= Extremely severe; 99= No answer

ElementDescription: [nas_recall] - Did you have any kind of injury for which you thought about getting treatment, whether or not you actually did get treatment?
Thinking about the most recent injury for which you thought about getting treatment, where did you first go for treatment? Did you go...
Notes: 1 = To an emergency room; 2 = To a private doctor or clinic; 3 = To some other place; 4 = Did you not go for treatment; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Still thinking about this same injury, in the six hours before it happened, did you drink any alcoholic beverage, even one drink, or use any of the drugs you mentioned earlier, not including tobacco products?
Notes: 1 = No, did not use alcohol or drugs; 2 = Yes, used alcohol only; 3 = Yes, used drugs only; 4 = Yes, used both alcohol and drugs; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: In the last 12 months, did you have any kind of illness for which you thought about getting treatment, whether or not you actually did get treatment?
Thinking about the most recent illness for which you thought about getting treatment, where did you first go for treatment?
Notes: 1 = To an emergency room; 2 = To a private doctor or clinic; 3 = To some other place; 4 = Did not go for treatment; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Still thinking about this same illness, in the six hours before you got sick or noticed this problem, did you drink any alcoholic beverage, even one drink, or use any of the drugs you mentioned earlier, not including tobacco products?
Notes: 1 = No, did not use alcohol or drugs; 2 = Yes, used alcohol only; 3 = Yes, used drugs only; 4 = Yes, used both alcohol and drugs; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Current gender identity
Notes: 0 = Male; 1 = Female; 2 = Trans male/Trans man; 3 = Trans female/Trans woman; 4 = Genderqueer or Gender non-conforming; 5 = Different identity; 6 = Non-binary; 7 = Refused/prefer not to answer; 8 = Do not know; 9 = Not listed; 10 = Multiple identities listed; 11 = Gender fluid; 999 = Missing

ElementDescription: 1b. What sex were you assigned at birth, what was on your original birth certificate?
Notes: 1=Male; 2=Female; 3=Intersex; 4 = Don''t know; 5=Other;-900 =Missing;-300=N/A; -999 =data not submitted (incomplete); -5=item seen but not answered

ElementDescription: Specify other Gender Identity
